snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, who has built a name for pushing ambitious causes in New York, is rolling out a plan to begin requiring residents to collect their food scraps.
abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg unveils ambitious new plan that will begin requiring New Yorkers to separate their food scraps for composting, emulating rules that have been established in dozens of smaller cities; under plan NYC will hire composting plant to process 100,000 tons of food scraps per year, amount that would represent about 10 percent of city's residential food waste.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, who has built a name for pushing ambitious causes in New York, is rolling out a plan to begin requiring residents to collect their food scraps.

headline.main: Bloomberg Plan Aims to Require Food Composting
headline.print_headline: Bloomberg Plan Aims to Require Food Composting
